1.text: Paul, prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timotheus the brother, to Philemon the beloved and our fellow-workman,

2.text: and to the sister Apphia and to Archippus our fellow-soldier, and to the assembly which [is] in thine house.

3.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and [the] Lord Jesus Christ.

4.text: I thank my God, always making mention of thee at my prayers,

5.text: hearing of thy love and the faith which thou hast towards the Lord Jesus, and towards all the saints,

6.text: in such sort that thy participation in the faith should become operative in the acknowledgment of every good thing which is in us towards Christ [Jesus].

7.text: For we have great thankfulness and encouragement through thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

8.text: Wherefore having much boldness in Christ to enjoin thee what is fitting,

9.text: for loveâ€™s sake I rather exhort, being such a one as Paul the aged, and now also prisoner of Jesus Christ.

10.text: I exhort thee for my child, whom I have begotten in [my] bonds, Onesimus,

11.text: once unserviceable to thee, but now serviceable to thee and to me:

12.text: whom I have sent back to thee: [but do thou receive] him, that is, my bowels:

13.text: whom I was desirous of keeping with myself, that for thee he might minister to me in the bonds of the glad tidings;

14.text: but I have wished to do nothing without thy mind, that thy good might not be as of necessity but of willingness:

15.text: for perhaps for this reason he has been separated [from thee] for a time, that thou mightest possess him fully for ever;

16.text: not any longer as a bondman, but above a bondman, a beloved brother, specially to me, and how much rather to thee, both in [the] flesh and in [the] Lord?

17.text: If therefore thou holdest me to be a partner [with thee], receive him as me;

18.text: but if he have wronged thee anything or owe anything [to thee], put this to my account.

19.text: I Paul have written [it] with mine own hand; I will repay [it]: that I say not to thee that thou owest even thine own self also to me.

20.text: Yea, brother, I would have profit of thee in [the] Lord: refresh my bowels in Christ.

21.text: Being confident of thine obedience, I have written to thee, knowing that thou wilt do even more than I say.

22.text: But withal prepare me also a lodging; for I hope that I shall be granted to you through your prayers.

23.text: Epaphras salutes thee, my fellow-prisoner in Christ Jesus;

24.text: Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke, my fellow-workmen.

25.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with your spirit.
